data.title: Famous People From Bangalore, India & Celebs Born In Bangalore
data.meta_description: Bangalore has produced a number of famous personalities, including models, golfers, actresses, actors etc.
data.text:
1

Tipu Sultan

(Ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore Based in South India)

98

45

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: December 1, 1751

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Died: May 4, 1799

Tipu Sultan, or the “Tiger of Mysore,” ruled the Kingdom of Mysore from 1782 to 1799. Apart from improving his kingdom’s military arrangements, he also established a new calendar, a new land-revenue system, and a coinage system. He died while defending the fort of Seringapatam in the Fourth Anglo-Mysore War.

Prakash Padukone

(Former Indian Badminton Player Who Became the First Indian to Win the All England Open Badminton Championships)

24

13

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: June 10, 1955

Sun Sign: Gemini

Arjuna Award- and Padma Shri-winning Indian badminton player and former world number 1, Prakash Padukone was the first to win the All-England Open Badminton Championship from India. A World Cup and Commonwealth Games champion, he co-owns Olympic Gold Quest. He is also known as Bollywood star Deepika Padukone’s father.

Remo D'Souza

(Indian Dancer and Choreographer Known for Directing 3D Dance Based Film 'ABCD' and its Sequels)

6

5

Listed In: Dancers

Birthdate: April 2, 1974

Sun Sign: Aries

Celebrated choreographer Remo D'Souza was a skilled athlete in his school days and quit studies after the 12th standard. The self-taught dancer revered Michael Jackson in his younger days. His choreography in Bajirao Mastani won him a National Award. He has also judged several seasons of Dance India Dance.

Recommended Lists:

9

Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw

(Indian Entrepreneur, Executive Chairperson and Founder of 'Biocon Limited' and 'Biocon Biologics Limited')

3

2

Listed In: Business People

Birthdate: March 23, 1953

Sun Sign: Aries

Biocon founder and chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw is a self-made billionaire entrepreneur who made it to Forbes’s Power Women 2020 list. Though she initially wished to be a brewer like her father, she later drifted to the biochemical industry. Apart from revolutionizing the Indian biopharma market, she also heads a charitable organization.

10

Rhea Chakraborty

(Actress)

2

11

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: July 1, 1992

Sun Sign: Cancer

Rhea Chakraborty is an Indian actress and video jockey best known for her association with MTV India where she started her career. Chakraborty made headlines in 2020 when she became entangled in controversies surrounding fellow actor Sushant Singh Rajput's suicide. Rajput's family accused Chakraborty of abetment of suicide and she received backlash on social media.

Ashwini Ponnappa

(Indian Badminton Player Known for Her Successful Partnership with Jwala Gutta)

4

4

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: September 18, 1989

Sun Sign: Virgo

Known for her match-winning partnership with Jwala Gutta, Indian badminton player Ashwini Ponnappa was born to a hockey player father but chose badminton over hockey. A 2-time Commonwealth Games and a 4-time South Asian Games champion, she is also a former World Championship bronze winner.

Prakash Belawadi

(Indian Theatre Artist, Director, Television and Media Personality)

0

0

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Film and theater actor Prakash Belawadi was born to theater artiste parents and thus grew up to follow in their footsteps. The Pratibha Bhushan-winning actor has been part of many Kannada and Hindi films, such as Airlift and Soorarai Pottru. He is also a qualified mechanical engineer.

Recommended Lists:

25

Hamsalekha

(Indian Film Composer and Songwriter)

0

1

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: June 23, 1951

Sun Sign: Cancer

Hamsalekha is an Indian songwriter and film composer who works predominantly for Kannada cinema. One of the most influential and celebrated music composers of the Kannada film industry, Hamsalekha is credited with popularizing Kannada songs in the rest of South India. He is the recipient of six Filmfare Awards, a National Film Award, and seven Karnataka State Film Awards.
